titles.title: That Men a godly Life Might Live
These Are the Holy Ten Commands

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: That man a godly life might live, God did these ten commandments give By His true servant Moses, high Upon the mount Sinai. Have mercy, Lord.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I am thy God and Lord alone, No other God besides Me own; On My great mercy venture thee, With all thy heart love thou Me.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: By idle word and speech profane Take not My holy Name in vain; And praise not aught as good and true But what God doth say and do.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Hallow the day which God hath blest, That thou and all thy house may rest; Keep hand and heart from labor free, That God may so work in thee.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Give to thy parents honor due, Be dutiful and loving too; And help them when their strength decays So shalt thou have length of days.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Kill thou not out of evil will,
Nor hate, nor render ill for ill;
Be patient and of gentle mood,
And to thy foe do thou good.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
Be faithful to thy marriage vows,
Thy heart give only to thy spouse
Keep thy life pure, and lest thou sin
Keep thyself with discipline.

verse.name: v8
v9
verse.lines:
Bear not false witness, nor belie
Thy neighbor by foul calumny;
Defend his innocence from blame,
With charity hide his shame.

verse.name: v10
verse.lines:
Thy neighbor's wife desire thou not,
His house, nor aught that he hath got
But wish that his such good may be
As thy heart doth wish for thee.

verse.name: v11
verse.lines:
God these commandments gave, therein
To show thee, son of man, thy sin,
And make thee also well perceive
How man for God ought to live.

verse.name: v12
verse.lines:
Help us, Lord Jesus Christ, for we A Mediator have in Thee;
Without Thy help our works so vain Merit naught but endless pain.
